unnormalised: Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Your Guide to the Indian Film Fest Scene
normalised: Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Your Guide to the Indian Film Fest Scene

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wondered what’s cooler than watching the latest SRK flick? (Okay, maybe *nothing*, but almost…) It's hitting up a film festival! India's brimming with them, and they're not just for serious movie critics sipping chai.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wondered what's cooler than watching the latest S R K flick? (Okay, maybe nothing, but almost…) It's hitting up a film festival! India's brimming with them, and they're not just for serious movie critics sipping chai.

unnormalised: Think of it as a giant celebration of storytelling, but with more masala and less pressure. You get to see movies you wouldn't normally find in your local multiplex, discover indie gems, and maybe even spot a celebrity or two (no guarantees on seeing Deepika, though!).
normalised: Think of it as a giant celebration of storytelling, but with more masala and less pressure. You get to see movies you wouldn't normally find in your local multiplex, discover indie gems, and maybe even spot a celebrity or two (no guarantees on seeing Deepika, though!).

unnormalised: From the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, which is a classic, to smaller, more focused fests, there's something for everyone. I remember attending the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI) a few years back. Absolutely mind-blowing! Saw this independent Malayalam film that completely changed my perspective on, well, everything! Plus, the vada pav stalls outside were *divine*.
normalised: From the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, which is a classic, to smaller, more focused fests, there's something for everyone. Plus, the vada pav stalls outside were divine.

unnormalised: But why bother, you ask? Because film festivals are where the magic happens. It's where new talent gets discovered, where conversations spark, and where you, the audience, get a chance to be part of something bigger than just another Friday night movie.
normalised: But why bother, you ask? Because film festivals are where the magic happens. It's where new talent gets discovered, where conversations spark, and where you, the audience, get a chance to be part of something bigger than just another Friday night movie.

unnormalised: Planning your festival hop? Do your research! Check out festival websites for schedules, ticketing info (some are free!), and special events. Dress comfortably – you'll be doing a lot of walking (and maybe queuing!). And most importantly, be open to new experiences. You might just find your next favorite director or stumble upon a film that stays with you long after the credits roll. Maybe IFFI Goa, sounds good, it is 1628 km from Delhi.

unnormalised: Don't be intimidated. Festivals like NFDC Film Bazaar are also awesome if you want to understand the whole film-making process. Think of it as behind the scenes with extra chai. Costs Rs 5000 to participate.

unnormalised: So, ditch Netflix for a weekend and dive into the Indian film festival scene. You might just surprise yourself. Happy watching!
